group_1.textCenter: Hm... I was summoned here by the head of@the clan, and I see you've all come as well...

group_1.textLeft: We're sorry for what happened earlier@today...
But there's something we really want@you to see.
We found this bangle on the shore@of your village.

group_1.textRight: Oh yes...this is a very old design.

group_1.textLeft: Oh? You're familiar with it?

group_1.textRight: Yes. It's similar in design to the bracelets@given to the girls in our village.

group_1.textLeft: I see...
We actually asked Yuta to take a look@at it first.
He said it was extremely old.
If it was washed up on the beach@from the sea...
...that means there might actually be a@sunken ship on the ocean floor, right?

group_1.textRight: Even if that were true, how would that@benefit us?

group_1.textLeft: Thinking back to the village legend, it could@mean it was just the ship that sank,
and the Diviner and the sailor might@have survived.
And if they did, that means they might not@have been killed out of divine retribution.
So if we find that shipwreck, we might@be able to prove it either way.

group_1.textRight: So you want me to reconsider the@village's custom...?

group_1.textLeft: Sir, please...! Can you get a survey done@on the ocean floor?

group_1.textRight: ...I need you to answer me one question.

group_1.textLeft: What is it?

group_1.textRight: You say this bangle was washed ashore@from the ocean...
But it doesn't show much weathering despite@how long it had been in the sea.

group_1.textLeft: ...W-would it?
I know it's very old, but...?

group_1.textRight: Had it been buried in the ground,@perhaps sealed in a box...
D-didn't we actually find it in a box that@was drifting around?!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, that's right...!

group_1.textRight: In that case, may you let me see it?
It surely was also weathered by the seawater,@so just a small piece of it will do.

group_1.textLeft: That's...
...I'm sorry.

group_1.narration: The elder admitted the shell bangle@was from a very long time ago,@and understood we were serious about@changing the village custom,@but he scolded us big time nevertheless...
Our weekend flew by as we wrote letter after@letter expressing our regrets for the trouble@we caused for the elder and the village,@and spent our days volunteering with@small tasks.
In the end, Mitama and I returned to Kamihama@without having accomplished anything...
I didn't think that mysterious voice had anything@to do with the sunken ship, but if I had done@more research on it, we might have learned something...
